columns.text:
When the board of directors is declassified, all members of the board must run for election, every one of the seats just on the board of directors would've been up for grabs in the election.

Investors benefit from a declassified board since they can vote out either director who fails to meet their expectations, in almost the same way, such a board is incapable of resisting a hostile offer.

Just a part of the members of such a categorized board stands for election at one time, even though other members participate in the election process at a later time, such a classified board seems to be necessary since if all of the board members are replaced or voted off, the entity would be left with no one to run it, because all of the former board members will be removed, the new board of directors may be inexperienced. 

As a consequence, the integrity of the board is maintained because only a piece of the board is modified on a classified board.

textbook.authors: Bradford D. Jordan, Randolph W. Westerfield, Stephen A. Ross
textbook.title: Fundamentals of Corporate Finance
